locations.title: Washington
locations.description: Washington is the 18th most extensive and the 13th most populous state. Approximately 60 percent of Washington's residents live in the Seattle metropolitan area.

locations.title: Nevada
locations.description: Nevada is officially known as the "Silver State" due to the importance of silver to its history and economy

locations.title: Illinois
locations.description: Three U.S. presidents have been elected while living in Illinois

locations.title: New York
locations.description: New York is a state in the Northeastern and Mid-Atlantic regions of the United States.

locations.title: Massachusetts
locations.description: Officially the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, is a state in the New England region of the northeastern United States.

locations.title: Georgia
locations.description: Georgia is known as the Peach State and the Empire State of the South.

locations.title: Florida
locations.description: The state capital is Tallahassee, the largest city is Jacksonville, and the largest metropolitan area is the Miami metropolitan area.

locations.title: Washington DC
locations.description: Washington, D.C., formally the District of Columbia is the capital of the United States.

locations.title: Las Vegas
locations.description: Las Vegas is an internationally renowned major resort city known primarily for gambling, shopping, fine dining and nightlife.

locations.title: Miami
locations.description: Miami's metro area is the eighth most populous and fourth-largest urban area in the United States.

locations.title: Chicago
locations.description: Let's take a photo in Chicago!
